item.title: U.S. Defense Chief Rebukes China as Warships Transit Taiwan Strait
item.description: Secretary Lloyd Austin said he was “deeply concerned” about the two rivals’ ability to manage a crisis.

item.title: Six Flags Has a New Summer Attraction. It's Not a Roller Coaster.
item.description: After a steep drop in attendance, the theme-park operator is trying to upgrade its brand; the wafting aroma of barbecue.

item.title: Online Banks Are Winning the Deposit War
item.description: Deposits rose recently at Ally, Goldman Sachs’s Marcus and Capital One, banks that either don’t have branch networks or have far fewer branches than peers.

item.title: Ukraine's Zelensky: We Are Ready for Counteroffensive
item.description: In a wide-ranging interview, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky also discussed U.S. elections, NATO and China.

item.title: The DOJ has closed its investigation into the potential mishandling of classified documents at Pence's home, according to a letter sent to a lawyer for Pence.
item.description: The DOJ has closed its investigation into the potential mishandling of classified documents at Pence’s home, according to a letter sent to a lawyer for Pence.

item.title: The debt-ceiling deal that passed the Senate late Thursday was the result of weeks of negotiations by the Biden administration and House Republicans, with leaders on each side claiming victory.
item.description: The debt-ceiling deal that passed the Senate late Thursday was the result of weeks of negotiations by the Biden administration and House Republicans, with leaders on each side claiming victory.

item.title: CIA Director Burns made a secret trip to China last month in a bid to keep lines of communication open, a U.S. official said.
item.description: CIA Director Burns made a secret trip to China last month in a bid to keep lines of communication open, a U.S. official said.

item.title: Three firms with ties to former chemical maker DuPont said they agreed to pay $1.185 billion in a proposed settlement of litigation over "forever chemicals."
item.description: Three firms with ties to former chemical maker DuPont said they agreed to pay $1.185 billion in a proposed settlement of litigation over “forever chemicals.”

item.title: A three-way train crash in India killed at least 233 people and injured hundreds more, in one of the most deadly train crashes in the country's history.
item.description: A three-way train crash in India killed at least 233 people and injured hundreds more, in one of the most deadly train crashes in the country’s history.

item.title: Ukraine's Zelensky said he is ready to launch a long-awaited counteroffensive but tempered a forecast of success with a warning that it could take some time and come at a heavy cost.
item.description: Ukraine’s Zelensky said he is ready to launch a long-awaited counteroffensive but tempered a forecast of success with a warning that it could take some time and come at a heavy cost.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: What’s News: World-Wide

item.title: Musk Can't Stop Talking About the Nonstop Grind
item.description: The billionaire is trying to motivate workers with talk of sacrifice as many of them are pushing for more of a work-life balance.

item.title: Online Banks Are Winning the Deposit War
item.description: Deposits rose recently at Ally, Goldman Sachs’s Marcus and Capital One, banks that either don’t have branch networks or have far fewer branches than peers.

item.title: What Engagement With China Has Meant for Me
item.description: For a Wall Street Journal reporter born in China, the mutual openness that began in the 1990s made it possible to envision a better future.

item.title: The SEC is dismissing 42 enforcement cases after finding that some of its employees improperly accessed legal records that should have been walled off from them.
item.description: The SEC is dismissing 42 enforcement cases after finding that some of its employees improperly accessed legal records that should have been walled off from them.

item.title: Disney said it would record a $1.5 billion impairment charge after removing certain content from its direct-to-consumer services.
item.description: Disney said it would record a $1.5 billion impairment charge after removing certain content from its direct-to-consumer services.

item.title: Twitter lost a second senior executive charged with content and safety issues, people familiar with the matter said, as it faces content moderation controversies and advertiser skittishness.
item.description: Twitter lost a second senior executive charged with content and safety issues, people familiar with the matter said, as it faces content moderation controversies and advertiser skittishness.

item.title: Major stock indexes jumped following the jobs report, with the Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq rising 2.1%, 1.5% and 1.1%, respectively.
item.description: Major stock indexes jumped following the jobs report, with the Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq rising 2.1%, 1.5% and 1.1%, respectively.

item.title: Hiring surged this spring, complicating the Fed's decision over whether to pause rate increases this month. U.S. employers added a seasonally adjusted 339,000 jobs in May.
item.description: Hiring surged this spring, complicating the Fed’s decision over whether to pause rate increases this month. U.S. employers added a seasonally adjusted 339,000 jobs in May.

item.title: Exxon and Chevron are in advanced talks with Algeria on a deal that would allow them to drill in the gas-rich nation, according to the Algerian energy minister and people familiar with the discussions.
item.description: Exxon and Chevron are in advanced talks with Algeria on a deal that would allow them to drill in the gas-rich nation, according to the Algerian energy minister and people familiar with the discussions.
